# MeetBalls — Local-First Meeting Assistant CLI

## Problem Statement

Meetings generate valuable information that is lost because note-taking is distracting,
recordings sit unwatched, and paid transcription services add cost and privacy concerns.
Developers need a zero-cost, privacy-respecting tool that captures meeting audio,
transcribes it locally, and enables interactive Q&A against the transcript using Claude Code CLI.

## What To Build

A minimal, opinionated, shell-script-driven CLI too... [truncated, 7285 chars total]
Q1: meetballs ask interaction model — single-shot with question vs interactive without question, or always interactive?
Q1 answered: meetballs ask uses dual-mode — single-shot with question (claude -p), interactive without question (claude --append-system-prompt). Both inject transcript as system context.

All requirements clear. PROMPT.md is thorough — 5 commands, success criteria, edge cases, non-goals all defined. Only ambiguity (Q1: ask dual-mode) resolved: single-shot with question via claude -p, interactive without question via claude --append-system-prompt.

Design complete. Requirements: specs/meetballs-cli/requirements.md (30+ requirements in 6 groups). Design: specs/meetballs-cli/design.md (architecture diagrams, component interfaces, error handling, testing strategy, tech choices). Key decisions: WAV 16kHz mono, PipeWire>PulseAudio>ALSA, base.en model, dual-mode ask, flat file storage.

All 5 criteria PASS. Design is thorough, implementable, simple, testable, and clear. One minor concern: pw-record WAV flags may need adjustment during implementation — design intent is unambiguous. No FAILs, no blocking concerns.

Greenfield project, no existing code. Key findings: pw-record WAV concern resolved, Claude CLI flags verified (v2.1.41), nested session constraint documented, bats-core install via git clone. All research in specs/meetballs-cli/research/ and context.md.

9-step TDD plan with 45+ test cases across 7 test files. Order: scaffolding → common → dispatcher → doctor → list → record → transcribe → ask → install. E2E scenario defined. Written to specs/meetballs-cli/plan.md.

9 code tasks generated in specs/meetballs-cli/tasks/ (task-00 through task-08). Order: scaffolding → common → dispatcher → doctor → list → record → transcribe → ask → install. TDD with 45+ test cases. All acceptance criteria in Given-When-Then format.
task-00 project scaffolding: git init, bin/meetballs, lib/common.sh, tests/test_helper.bash, install.sh (bats-core), .gitignore. 7/7 tests passing. All acceptance criteria met.

task-01 common utilities: lib/common.sh with all shared functions (constants, mb_init, messaging, mb_check_command, mb_check_disk_space, mb_detect_audio_backend, mb_format_duration, mb_recording_dir, mb_transcript_dir, mb_timestamp). tests/test_common.bats with 29 test cases. Full suite 36/36 passing. All acceptance criteria met.
